answers.answer: Your TSH looks high.  Unless you got your decimal in the wrong place suggesting hypo, your symptoms suggest hyper.You are not on thyroid meds. yet.What does doctor say.

Dr says that it is no problem that the tsh is fine at 13.200 because other levels are fine.  I don't really understand any of it and just feel like **** all the time.  My resting heartrate is 120 and if I do anything it goes up into the 140's.  Doctor says all is well, i just need to relax.

I think you need to get a second opinion.Per AACE 2006 amended guidelines,  the US Government 2004 Guidelines, UK 2006 Guidelines,  American Thyroid Association and The Endocrine Society -  Albert Einstein College of Medicine, New York. September 23, 2004 .quote - TSH Higher Than 10 mIU/L Hypothyroidism Levothyroxine therapy is reasonable.  - unquote

Thank you.  I am going to schedule an appointment with an endo as soon as I can get one.  Anything I can do in the meantime because my pcp is not taking this seriously?  Are my smptoms normal for my tsh level?

No, your symptoms are more hyperthyroid and your TSH level states hypothyroid.  That is why I asked if you got the decimal incorrect.Make sure the endo treats many thyroid patients yearly.  Most deal in diabetes and thyroid down the list.Nothing you can do right now. But I'd fire your pcp!Good luck

Hi.  Back in 2004 I was diagnosed as being hyper... My heart would race faster than normal, my legs would shake at times and I felt like I was going out of my mind.  Any Dr. that tells you to relax - specifically when you are feeling like that is not a Dr. worth having.  I was treated w/ radiaition to knock my thyroid from going crazy - my lab results were also through the sky - and regret it more than anything.  I truely believe that there is a HUGE connection between being treated w/ radiation to slow your thyroid down and thyroid cancer.  I am living proof.In 2006 I was diagnosed w/ Thyroid Cancer and had a  radical surger - cut from ear to ear b/c it had spread so quickly -which is unsusal - but b/c I got pregant, the estrogen my body produced acted like a fertilizer for the cancer.I STRONGLY SUGGEST!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! You find another Dr. and get yourself regulated b/c you lab resluts are not in the normal range.  I just had a TSH test done and I was 0.26 the normal range is 0.34-5.60 according to the Dr.s at Emory University in Atlanta, GA.I live in kennesaw 1 hour away (without traffic) from the hospital but I go to the very best available to me b/c it's sooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo very worth it.  Find out if one of your Dr.s (maybe your primary care physician) can give you something to calm you down while you figure out how to your body back to normal.Don't let anyone tell you to relax when you are feeling the way you are - I know, I have been there and there is no possible way to relax - especially when it feels like you are running a marathon when you are not even moving.Good luck!Linda

question: Hi I just had my tsh level tested because I have been having periods of rapid heart beath, increased bowel movements, night sweats and irritability.  My TSH is 13.200,   T7 IS 4.0,  THYROXINE IS 5.04,  T3 UPTAKE 25.3.  are these normal?
title: TSH level
